case_title: TANVIR AHMED KHAN vs HAMID MUKHTAR and 3 others
reference_no_or_id: Review Petition No. 474 of 2004 in R.O.R. No. 1693 of 2003
complaint_summary: Dispute arose over the appointment of Lamberdar of Chak No. 294/GB, Tehsil Toba Tek Singh, following the death of the previous Lamberdar. The petitioner was appointed by the District Officer (Revenue), but the respondent appealed and succeeded in overturning the decision.
investigation_summary: The petitioner argued that he was more qualified, owned more land, and was younger and more capable than the respondent. The respondent relied on a Supreme Court precedent prohibiting the Board of Revenue from adjudicating Lamberdar cases.
judgment_summary: The court accepted the review petition, setting aside the orders of the Executive District Officer (Revenue) and Member (Judicial-V), Board of Revenue, Punjab. The court upheld the original appointment of the petitioner as Lamberdar by the District Officer (Revenue).
Decision_or_verdict: Review petition accepted; petitioner reinstated as Lamberdar.
legal_arguments: Petitioner argued preferential qualifications including education (F.Sc vs primary pass), land ownership (76 Kanals vs 8 Kanals), and age.
Respondent argued reliance on Supreme Court precedent (PLD 1965 SC 393) prohibiting Board of Revenue from adjudicating Lamberdar cases.

assets.details: Petitioner owns 76 Kanals, 14 Marlas; Respondent owns 8 Kanals.

sections: Section 8 of Board of Revenue Act, 1957
key_issues: Applicability of Supreme Court precedent on Board of Revenue jurisdiction

legal_terms.Lamberdar: Village headman responsible for revenue collection and administrative duties.

words_and_phrases.Preferential Edge: Superior qualifications or advantages in comparison to others.

summary_vector_notes: Dispute over Lamberdar appointment resolved in favor of petitioner based on qualifications, land ownership, and administrative suitability. Supreme Court precedent deemed inapplicable due to updated rules.
